title: Tea Bags for Controlling Postoperative Bleeding after Extraction of Teeth: A Review of Literature.
abstract: One of the most common invasive oral procedures performed in routine dental practice is tooth extraction, and post-extraction bleeding (PEB) is a recognized and commonly occurring complication. Many different methods have been proposed to address PEB. When compared to other topical hemostatic medicines, green tea has become an effective substitute. This article provides a brief review on the use of tea bags as topical hemostasis agent dental surgeons may wish to take advantage of.
